title.narrative: Targeted Supplementary Food component of PRRO 10665 Responding to Humanitarian Crises and Enhancing Resilience to Food Insecurity

description.narrative: Preliminary findings from the 2008 TSF Outcome Evaluation Study looking at recoveries, defaults and mortality in the TSF programme conducted in four regions (Amhara, Afar, Tigray and Somali) show that on average 55.6% of the malnourished children recovered after three months of support, 1.8% defaulted after identification and 1.4% died. It should be noted that the relatively low recovery was due to excessive food sharing exacerbated by the drought. The coverage in the EOS/TSF woredas, however, ranged from 63-93% well over the 50% Sphere standard for supplementary feeding programmes.

owner-org.narrative: UN OCHA Central Emergency Response Fund (CERF)

organisation.narrative: UN Office for the Coordination of Humanitarian Affairs (OCHA)

mailing-address.narrative: United Nations Office for the Coordination of Humanitarian Affairs (OCHA), Central Emergency Response Fund (CERF), 2 United Nations Plaza (DC2), East 44th street (13th floor), United Nations, New York, USA

description.narrative: Disbursement to CERF Project Targeted Supplementary Food component of PRRO 10665 Responding to Humanitarian Crises and Enhancing Resilience to Food Insecurity

condition.narrative: CERF funding is based on an agreed proposal, including specific planned outcomes and outputs.
